content: than your pumpkin and poke it through the top either side of the pumpkin can be used at this point for your top according to your preference the curly stem part was made by wrapping a bit of wire around a toothpick this pattern can be easily sized up to use all sorts of scrap yarn from your stash just by choosing a larger weight yarn but remember to go down a needle size or two from what you would normally use with that weight yarn in order to keep the stuffing inside and hidden remember there is nothing stopping you from making a fluorescent pink pumpkin or a sparkly purple pumpkin or one black as night just like there is nothing wrong with choosing natural pumpkin colors let your imagination guide you abbreviations bor beginning of round dpn double point needles k knit kfb knit front and back 1 st increase kfb-m knit front and back modified knit 1 stitch as you normally do but do not slip the original stitch off the left needle then with the yarn still in back insert the right needle back into the stitch on the left needle from right to left and slip it off the left needle 1 st increase k2tog knit 2 together p purl the two smaller pumpkins are actually p2tog purl 2 together the same size the shortest pumpkin st s stitch es just has the yarn ends pulled tighter for alternative shaping
